casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Juan Pablo GUERRA-SEGURA, Defendant-Appellant. No. 04-40633.

Conference Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Decided June 22, 2005. James Lee Turner, Assistant U.S. Attorney, U.S. Attorney’s Office Southern District of Texas, Houston, TX, for PlaintiffAppellee. Juan Pablo Guerra-Segura, Texas Department of Criminal Justice Institutional Division, Kenedy, TX, for Defendant-Appellant.

*715Before WIENER, BENAVIDES, and DENNIS, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM: *

Counsel appointed to represent Juan Pablo Guerra-Segura has moved for leave to withdraw and has filed a brief pursuant to Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Guerra-Segura has not filed a response. Our review of the brief filed by counsel as well as our review of the record discloses no nonfrivolous issue for appeal. Accordingly, the motion for leave to withdraw is GRANTED, counsel is excused from further responsibilities, and the APPEAL IS DISMISSED. See 5th Cir. R. 42.2.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except under the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
